DOC.brief_summary: The study aim compare successful spinal needle insertion obese non-obese pregnant woman cross leg sit position undergo cesarean section
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Successful Spinal Needle Insertion Between Obese Non-obese Pregnant Women
DOC.detailed_description: Approval Ethical Committee Faculty Medicine University Indonesia acquire prior conduct study . Subjects give informed consent enrol study.Subjects sit cross leg sit position : patient sit thigh abduct , knee flex medially , foot sol contralateral thigh . The back flexed maximally , subject ' chin approach sternum , subject hug pillow . Lumbal puncture do use Quincke needle 25G/27G L4-5 intervertebral gap reach subarachnoid space ( confirm free flow cerebrospinal fluid ) . Data record number attempt successful spinal puncture , number spinal needle-bone contact blood vessel puncture incidence . Data analyze use Statistical Package Social Scientist ( SPSS ) , numerical data use unpaired T-test Mann-Whitney-U test , categorical data use Chi-square test Fischer Exact 's Test . Data normality test Kolmogorov-Smirnov test . Significant value p < 0.05 .
DOC.criteria: Subjects age 1845 year old , American Society Anesthesiologists ( ASA ) physical status IIII plan undergo caesarian section spinal anesthesia cross leg sit position . Subjects explain study , agree enroll sign informed consent form Subjects contraindications spinal anesthesia Subjects fetal 's head trap , umbilical prolapse , foot presentation Subjects preeclampsia Subjects cardiovascular disease Subjects scoliosis Subjects recent lumbal surgery history Subjects sit cross leg sit position . Drop criterion : Subjects worsen condition spinal anesthesia Subjects fail spinal needle insertion thus receive general anesthesia Subjects twin pregnancy Subjects drop study .
